text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/241572794f7e93d2f8b762de2300e5f7e4f07628|patch 8.2.1471: :const only locks the variable, not the value>
patch 8.2.1471: :const only locks the variable, not the value

Problem:    :const only locks the variable, not the value.
Solution:   Lock the value as ":lockvar 1 var" would do. (closes #6719)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1471: :const only locks the variable, not the value · vim/vim@2415727
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1471: :const only locks the variable, not the value · vim/vim@2415727
attachments.text: Problem: :const only locks the variable, not the value. Solution: Lock the value as ":lockvar 1 var" would do. (closes #6719)

<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/f923571ec17b6caeeb7f4abfd7eec3f707ab9c45|patch 8.2.1468: Vim9: invalid error for missing white space>
patch 8.2.1468: Vim9: invalid error for missing white space

Problem:    Vim9: invalid error for missing white space.
Solution:   Don't skip over white space after index. (closes #6718)

attachments.title: patch 8.2.1468: Vim9: invalid error for missing white space · vim/vim@f923571
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: invalid error for missing white space. Solution: Don't skip over white space after index. (closes #6718)

patch 8.2.1467: Vim9: :echomsg doesn't like a dict argument

Problem:    Vim9: :echomsg doesn't like a dict argument.
Solution:   Convert arguments like in legacy script. (closes #6717)

patch 8.2.1466: Vim9: cannot index or slice a variable with type "any"

Problem:    Vim9: cannot index or slice a variable with type "any".
Solution:   Add runtime index and slice.
